intro: Rhexia mariana var. mariana, commonly known as the showy rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands, bogs, and along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive wavy margin. The showy rhexia is an important nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
